main_definition: Chancellor is a title or position of authority, often used to refer to the head of government or an important official in various institutions.

meanings_and_examples.example: In Germany, the Chancellor is the country's head of government.
The chancellor of a university presides over its administration and academic matters.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Highest official in the Catholic Church, second only to the Pope
meanings_and_examples.example: The Cardinal-electors gather at the cathedral to choose a new pope from among themselves after the death or resignation of an incumbent Pope.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An officer responsible for maintaining and managing records in various institutions
meanings_and_examples.example: The chancellor of a public office is tasked with keeping all official documents and archives up to date.
